intro: Eritrichium longifolium, commonly known as the longleaf eritrichium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as rocky soils and gravelly plains. It produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
